metadata.title: CVE-2019-3500 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
aria2c in aria2 1.33.1, when --log is used, can store an HTTP BasicAuthentication username and password in a file, which might allow localusers to obtain sensitive information by reading this file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

aria2 - 1.34.0-4
libaria2-0 - 1.34.0-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: aria2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.34.0-4').
